title: Blues lose top-line scorer Vladimir Tarasenko for at least five months
text:
USA TODAY

The St. Louis Blues, a team that overcame considerable adversity to win the Stanley Cup last season, will have to do it again if they want to repeat.

The Blues announced Monday that top-line scorer Vladimir Tarasenko, 27, will have shoulder surgery Tuesday and will be reevaluated in five months, just as the regular season is ending.

Tarasenko, the team's most dynamic scorer, has scored 33 or more goals for five consecutive seasons, and he scored 11 goals during the Blues' dramatic run to the Stanley Cup championship.

Last season, the Blues were last in the NHL in early January and then recovered to win the title.

Tarasenko suffered his injury Oct. 24, playing just 4:37 before leaving the game. He has 10 points in 10 games this season.

Because Tarasenko is on the long-term injured reserve, the Blues will have cap space available if they want to make a move to add another scorer.
description: The Blues overcame adversity to win the Stanley Cup last year, and now they will have to do it again. Vladimir Tarasenko is out at least five months.
